title: Refactor to stateless zoom architecture
description:
## Problem
Current snapshot-based architecture causes bugs:
- Stale snapshots when panes close/open
- Layout corruption when snapshot references dead panes
- Doesn't adapt to window resize

## Solution
Switch to stateless zoom calculation:
- Read CURRENT layout on each focus change
- Calculate zoom from scratch using window dimensions
- Keep snapshot ONLY for restoring original layout on toggle OFF

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Zoom works correctly when switching panes
- [ ] Pane close doesn't corrupt layout
- [ ] Window resize is handled gracefully
- [ ] Toggle OFF restores original (or gracefully skips if panes changed)
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] Integration test harness validates real tmux behavior

title: Implement stateless zoom calculation
description:
## Changes
1. Modify ApplyZoom to read current layout instead of snapshot
2. Keep snapshot for restore-only (toggle OFF)
3. On toggle OFF, detect pane count mismatch and skip restore gracefully
4. Remove snapshot-dependent logic from zoom path

## Files to modify
- layout.go: ApplyZoom function
- state.go: possibly simplify state structure
- main.go: toggle logic

title: Create integration test harness
description:
## Goal
Create automated tests that run against real tmux to catch regressions.

## Approach
- Shell script or Go test that spawns tmux server
- Creates panes, enables zoom, switches focus
- Verifies layout dimensions are correct
- Cleans up after

## Test Cases
1. Two panes horizontal - zoom works both directions
2. Three panes - zoom distributes correctly
3. Pane close while zoom active - no corruption
4. Toggle off - restores original
5. Window resize - adapts correctly
close_reason: Integration test harness complete with 3 test scenarios
